summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeColourPop's Chrome Liquid Eyeshadow is packed with sparkling multichrome pigment and ultra-reflective pearls for a high impact, multi-dimensional finish. Each unique shade delivers a vibrant color shift with every angle of light for a mesmerizing multi-layered look in just one swipe!
details: DetailsBenefitsIntense color-shifting pigmentUltra-reflective pearlsHigh impact colorSmooth liquid formulaMess-freeItem 2611222How To UseFirst, prep your eyes with Party Proof Eyeshadow Primer (sold separately) for a smooth canvas and even application. It will boost the vibrancy of your shadow and it will make your eyeshadow more long-lasting throughout the day.For a sheer wash of colour, apply a thin layer and blend upwards with a synthetic, fluffy brush or your fingertips to diffuse the shadow.For bolder, fuller coverage application, allow first layer of shadow to completely dry down. Use the doe foot to apply a second layer onto eyelid and blend with your fingertips to ensure vibrancy.As an eyeliner: Use an eyeliner brush and apply close to the lashline.IngredientsBliss: Isododecane, Silica, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Ethylene/Propylene/Styrene Copolymer, Microcrystalline Wax, Triacontanyl PVP, Titanium/Titanium Dioxide, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Butylene/Ethylene/Styrene Copolymer, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Hexylene Glycol, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Aluminum. May Contain: Bismuth Oxychloride (Ci 77163), Iron Oxides (Ci 77491, Ci 77492, Ci 77499), Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891).
how_to_use: First, prep your eyes with Party Proof Eyeshadow Primer (sold separately) for a smooth canvas and even application. It will boost the vibrancy of your shadow and it will make your eyeshadow more long-lasting throughout the day.For a sheer wash of colour, apply a thin layer and blend upwards with a synthetic, fluffy brush or your fingertips to diffuse the shadow.For bolder, fuller coverage application, allow first layer of shadow to completely dry down. Use the doe foot to apply a second layer onto eyelid and blend with your fingertips to ensure vibrancy.As an eyeliner: Use an eyeliner brush and apply close to the lashline.

reviews.headline: Gorgeous color
reviews.comments: I got this as a sample and on a whim I put it on and loved it!  Lightweight and very cute, yet you can wear it to your job and still look professional.  Will definitely be buying different colors for fun!

reviews.headline: Vibrant!
reviews.comments: Color is so vibrant. Does not come off except with makeup remover!

reviews.headline: Shreds eyelid skin
reviews.comments:
Gorgeous colors and sheen but no matter what I used to remove, the metallic glitters tore and sliced eyelid skin. 

Tossed.

reviews.headline: I would purchase it again
reviews.comments: Beautiful color

reviews.headline: Yes
reviews.comments: I love this product so much it looks amazing on my eyes and it looks so beautiful the liquid eyeshadow great pigmentation on my eyes and the formula was so smooth texture and it easy to apply on my eyes and it didn't felt smudged at all

reviews.headline: NOT For Sensitive Eyes
reviews.comments: I tested this product by itself on my eyelids and the tiny glitter particles made my eyes itchy and kept transferring into my eyes especially if i had to rub my eyes. I couldnt keep it on more than a couple hours and by the time i removed it my eyelid was puffy and the oil glands on my waterline were clogged. I also tried it over another eyeshadow on my arm and it doesnt layer over other products nicely it just gets patchy and removes the product underneath. Its pretty but not worth the stye i got from it

reviews.headline: Love this so much
reviews.comments: This is a great eyeshadow. It stays on all day and it looks awesome.

reviews.headline: Really cool color shift
reviews.comments: I actually loved the one I tried so much, I went back for another shade!  These can be super subtle w/just 1-2 swipes across your lower lid just above the lash line, or really dramatic.  So glad I tried it.

reviews.headline: Beautiful Colors!
reviews.comments:
I absolutely adore this brand of liquid eyeshadow. The colors are magical. I love how long lasting the formula is and it doesn't flake off or smudge...even on my hooded, watery eyes. 

The only FYI I have is that the shade "glaze" dries almost completely yellow/gold.  It is pictured as a lot more white when it dries down.  However, it is a beautiful yellow/gold. I just don't want someone to be disappointed because the online photo is a little different. I am working towards owning all the shades available in this collection.

reviews.headline: really pigmented!
reviews.comments: i really love how pigmented and shimmery this is!! a lot of my drugstore shimmer powder eyeshadows don't give me the level of shimmer i want for very long so this is a great addition. when i put one coat on alone my husband was a little apprehensive about how shiny it was for a relatively classy event so i did go over with powder shimmer and that combo worked PERFECTLY for a regular event. i would wear the shimmer alone to a concert, festival, or girls' night out kinda vibe.

reviews.headline: Love it. Would buy again!!
reviews.comments: Looks great!!

reviews.headline: Caused Irritation
reviews.comments: This made my eyelids burn. I had a hard time washing it off after it dried.

reviews.headline: The pain was intense. Removal was even worse.
reviews.comments:
I don't have sensitive skin. This burned really bad about 5 minutes after drying down. It burned on my lids and on my undereyes. I went to remove it, and it would not come off. Typically, micellar water works really well for me, and the makeup is off after a couple of gentle swipes with a reusable bamboo "cotton" pad. This stuff would not budge, so I had to get rough with it.

It hurt SO BAD when I was removing it- it felt like sand or tiny shards of glass. Terrible experience. And I see now that I'm not the only one. The same exact thing happened to me when I used the Ulta Solar Flare Gel Chrome eyeshadow. 

I checked, compared the ingredients for both, and I found they both have a few of the same ones that I am almost positive I've never had on my eyes before. I checked all of my eyeshadows and they are not present in the ingredients lists. I am very familiar and experienced with skincare ingredients, and the few identifiable ones I saw in both of the products are also in my skincare products, and they do not cause a reaction on my skin.

I narrowed it down to the following ingredients that are new for me:

Aluminum
Aluminum hydroxide
Aluminum calcium sodium silicate

I am of course not saying that others who had a bad reaction have an intolerance to these ingredients, I'm just sharing what I know about my own experience.  Of course it may be a case of certain ingredients combined that caused the reaction I had, but I'm doing all I can! I will be trying to avoid those ingredients from now on. 

I used shade Bliss. It was absolutely gorgeous, I'll give it that. I'm bummed because these look amazing and I was so excited to get them.

reviews.headline: Got the shade Beetle
reviews.comments: so gorgeous, I wish it never ran out üòî‚úäÔ∏è

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Love all three of these I have tried. Beautiful color with great shift and doesn't crease. Will absolutely repurchase!

reviews.headline: Such Promise, More Disaster
reviews.comments:
I really wanted to love these shimmery eyeshadows. The swatched colors online look glorious. I bought three and applied as a test as soon as I reached home. Two on upoer eyelid, the green was a liner under each eye. 

Application was not smooth. Both on the eyelids streaked, requiring multiple swipes of the doe foot applicator. Fuzz came off one applicator and had to be picked off several times. The green as a liner was streaky but only had to be touched up once. 

When the eyeshadows were finally smooth swipes across my eyelids, I noticed that the product didnt want to stay in the crease and bunched up, requiring me to smooth it upward with a fingertip. This meant I now had to apply it there. I thought that meant that was probably the best place; application there was smoother. 

Thinking all was well, I started about my afternoon then noticed my eyelids were burning. I hoped that sensation would calm down; it didnt. When I reached a mirror, I discovered much of the shadow along the brow line had flaked.  The product on the eyelids looked great but was now stinging.

Upon removing the product, I discovered both eyelids were red and sensitive. I washed then applied a serum, but it was several minutes hefore my skin stopped hurting. 

I cannot recommend this product at all. It's a wonderful idea: a glimmering and iridescent ombre. However, those with sensitive skin should avoid it. Stick with the colourpop pan shadows; I don't react to those, and they wear all day without streaking or flaking.

reviews.headline: Shades vary
reviews.comments: I bought the Color Beetle & Color Morpho. I really like the green shade‚Äîmy daughter told me I was wearing "mermaid eyeshadow." I am not as big a fan of the Color Morpho, however. I got it because I wanted a true blue, but there is no shift in this shade: the cobolt just mixes with the purple, so it's really only purple. If you want purple, you'll probably like this. But since I wanted blue, I'm a bit disappointed.

reviews.headline: Chrome to the Dome
reviews.comments: One of the finest inexpensive companies with the most intensely pigmented colors. Their eyeliners and eye shadows are exactly what magic is made of. Every color is popping! The chromatic edition is remarkable! The wear is long lasting and very much loved by all.

reviews.headline: Best liquid chrome eyeshadows ever!
reviews.comments: I highly recommend these liquid chrome eyeshadows! My skin is super oily and these last after a 12 hour shift at work. I use an eyeshadow primer then an opaque powder eyeshadow and then put this on top with ZERO fallout. I get compliments galore. Beetle is my fav because it matches my hair. I have tried others (Stila, Juvias Place) and Colourpop has emerged the winner!

reviews.headline: Bad
reviews.comments: This pigment scratched my eyes and its basically impossible to blend out. Would mot reccomend.

faceoff_positive.comments:
I tried all the colors, but the vest two are Morpho (blue) and Supernova (purple). The colors are rich and make amazing eye liner. Morpho actually looks more purple-y in person than it does online, and i love it. Bliss stays pink rather than color shifting. Same with See U Later - it stays a minty green color. Decode ans Glaze have aomw color shifting, but they mostly stay as their primary color (bronze for Decode, gold for Glaze). These shadows dry FAST, so there is very litte time to work with them. Know how and where you are going to apply the color beforehand. The doe foot applicator works better than a shadow brush for applying. If you want to use as a liner, use your liner brush to get product off the applicator. Once dried, these shadows stick to your lids like crazy, even without using a primer and through sweating. It took a good bi-phase makeup remover and some scrubbing to loosen the shadow for removal, then followed up with a cleansing balm. Regular face wash or plain soap and water barely make a dent in removing these shadows. Again, this is without using any kind of primer and after a full day of wear. For any liner brush you might have used, make sure you clean it as soon as you can so this shadow doesn't dry on the bristles. 

Overall, I'm prett happy with these shadows. The color shift isn't as intense as the pics shows, but the colors are still beautiful. The staying power is amazing. These would be great for any event or outing where you want your shadow to last all day - even on oily lids or after breaking a sweat - so you don't have to carry a makeup bag around with you for touch-ups. They'd also be good for face painting or cosplay.
faceoff_positive.headline: Darker colors are the best of the bunch
